alert.note: Alert for Hillsborough (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 02 at 4:07PM EDT until September 04 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Florida... Alafia River At Lithia affecting Hillsborough County. .Local rivers continue rising in response to heavy rainfall from Idalia. For the Alafia...including Lithia ...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Alafia River at Lithia. * WHEN...Until late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, River Drive and Squirrel Run Way downstream of County Road 640 are completely covered by water. One home begins to flood. At 15.0 feet, Additional residences downstream of County Road 640 bridge begin flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 14.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 PM EDT Saturday was 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.1 feet on 10/04/1969. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 pm EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Wed Thu Alafia River Lithia 13.0 14.0 Sat 3 pm 13.7 12.5 10.5 7.9 6.4 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Sunday morning at 715 AM EDT.
